greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Limiting row sequence of the array A128628.
comment: Conjecture:  The length of maximal initial segment of this sequence that is identical to row n of A128628 is A025065(n+1), for n >= 1.
Beginning with the 2nd term, the sequence is a concatenation of segments that begin with 2:
link: Clark Kimberling, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2000
example: Successive rows of A128628 (as in Jason Kimberley's comment: in row n, the k-th term is the number of parts in the k-th partition of n, assuming the parts of each partition are in nonincreasing order):
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, May 24 2019
